title: OpenStreetMap API
text: basic example shows get map data: Get notes: Get GPX data:
code: library(osmapiR) #> Data (c) OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright  # For testing edition without breaking the OSM data, # make calls to `https://master.apis.dev.openstreetmap.org`  # set_osmapi_connection(server = "testing") # lacks data  bbox <- c(2.4166059, 42.5945594, 2.4176574, 42.5962101)  ## Download objects by bounding box osm_objs <- osm_bbox_objects(bbox = bbox, tags_in_columns = TRUE)  ## View history of an object sel <- osm_objs$`name:ca` %in% "Abadia de Sant Miquel de Cuixà" obj <- osm_objs[sel, ]  obj_history <- osm_history_object(osm_type = obj$type, osm_id = obj$id) # tags in a list column obj_history #>   type       id visible version changeset           timestamp     user    uid #> 1  way 50343004    TRUE       1   3882565 2010-02-15 12:14:11  Skywave  10927 #> 2  way 50343004    TRUE       2  13314595 2012-09-30 19:52:28 petrovsk  90394 #> 3  way 50343004    TRUE       3  53623614 2017-11-08 22:08:33    JFK73 662440 #> 4  way 50343004    TRUE       4 103004865 2021-04-15 15:41:02 petrovsk  90394 #>    lat  lon                                                         members #> 1 <NA> <NA> 44 nodes: 639618609, 639618608, 639618720, 639618717, 639618... #> 2 <NA> <NA> 44 nodes: 639618609, 639618608, 639618720, 639618717, 639618... #> 3 <NA> <NA> 44 nodes: 639618609, 639618608, 639618720, 639618717, 639618... #> 4 <NA> <NA> 48 nodes: 639618609, 639618608, 8632687795, 8632687796, 8632... #>                                                                                  tags #> 1 8 tags: amenity=place_of_worship | building=yes | denomination=catholic | histor... #> 2 8 tags: amenity=place_of_worship | building=yes | denomination=catholic | histor... #> 3 15 tags: amenity=place_of_worship | building=yes | denomination=catholic | herit... #> 4 15 tags: amenity=place_of_worship | building=yes | denomination=catholic | herit...  # obj_history$tags notes <- osm_read_bbox_notes(bbox = bbox, closed = -1) notes #>         lon        lat      id #> 1 2.4170566 42.5948042 1730475 #> 2 2.4170552 42.5949259  628602 #>                                                       url comment_url close_url #> 1 https://api.openstreetmap.org/api/0.6/notes/1730475.xml        <NA>      <NA> #> 2  https://api.openstreetmap.org/api/0.6/notes/628602.xml        <NA>      <NA> #>          date_created status #> 1 2019-03-31 14:10:04 closed #> 2 2016-07-15 07:09:19 closed #>                                                          comments #> 1                     2 comments from 2019-03-31 by Sherpa66, Syl #> 2 5 comments from 2016-07-15 to 2018-05-25 by Dolfo54, rainerU...  # notes$comments ## Requires authentication usr_traces <-  osm_list_gpxs() osm_get_gpx_metadata(gpx_id = 3790367) osm_get_data_gpx(gpx_id = 3790367, format = "R") gpx <- osm_get_points_gps(bbox = bbox) gpx #> [[1]] #>          lat       lon #> 1 42.5945734 2.4166662 #> 2 42.5945770 2.4166060 #> 3 42.5945770 2.4166640 #> 4 42.5945770 2.4166880 #> 5 42.5945890 2.4167120 #> 6 42.5945999 2.4166340 #> 7 42.5946030 2.4166390 #> 8 42.5946100 2.4166260 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "osmapi_gpx" "list"

title: OpenStreetMap API
text: osmdata implements Overpass API query data OSM. osmexctract matches, downloads, converts imports bulk OSM data (.pbf files) OpenStreetMap Accesses high resolution raster maps using OpenStreetMap protocol. osmapiR package access OSM data maps data (map notes, GPS traces, changelogs users). can also useful get history OSM objects package allows editing upload kind data. access OSM map data purposes editing exploring history objects, perhaps better use packages implements Overpass API (osmdata) works .pbf files (osmexcract).

title: Configure connections from osmapiR — set_osmapi_connection
text: Functions configure connections. Probably, use set_osmapi_connection.

title: Configure connections from osmapiR — set_osmapi_connection
code: set_osmapi_connection(   server = c("openstreetmap.org", "testing"),   cache_authentication )  get_osmapi_url()  set_osmapi_url(osmapi_url)

title: Configure connections from osmapiR — set_osmapi_connection
text: server openstreetmap.org (default), API calls performed servers production. testing, calls https://master.apis.dev.openstreetmap.org without affecting main OSM data. cache_authentication TRUE, authentication token cached disk. reduces number times need re-authenticate cost storing access credentials disk. Cached tokens encrypted automatically deleted 30 days creation. missing (default), changes applied. package load time, option set FALSE yet set. osmapi_url desired API URL send calls.

title: Configure connections from osmapiR — set_osmapi_connection
text: Configure .Options[grep("^osmapir\\.[-z]+_(?!secret$)", names(.Options), perl = TRUE)] :) return osmapir.base_api_url.

title: Configure connections from osmapiR — set_osmapi_connection
text: testing software API consider using https://master.apis.dev.openstreetmap.org instead live-api (set_osmapi_connection("testing")). account live service database, probably need new username password test service; please visit page browser sign . set_osmapi_url() get_osmapi_url deal API base URL. hand, set_osmapi_connection also configure authentication parameters needed PUT, POST DELETE calls. details, see https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/API_v0.6.

what: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
text: following command returns: nodes inside given bounding box relations reference . ways reference least one node inside given bounding box, relations reference [ways], nodes outside bounding box ways may reference. relations reference one nodes, ways relations included due rules. ('''''' apply recursively, see explanation .)

title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
text: bbox Coordinates area retrieve map data (left,bottom,right,top). format Format output. Can R (default), xml, json. tags_in_columns FALSE (default), tags objects saved single list column tags containing data.frame OSM object keys values. TRUE, add column key. Ignored format != "R".

title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
text: format = "R", returns data frame one OSM object per row. format = "xml", returns xml2::xml_document following OSM_XML format. format = "json", returns list json structure following OSM_JSON format.

title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
text: Note , command returns relations reference aforementioned nodes ways, reverse true: (necessarily) return nodes ways referenced relations. prevents unreasonably-large result sets. example, imagine case : relation named "England" references every node England. nodes, ways, relations retrieved bounding box covers small portion England. result include nodes, ways, relations specified rules command, including "England" relation, (fortuitously) include every node way England. desired, nodes ways referenced "England" relation retrieved respective IDs. Also note ways intersect bounding box nodes within bounding box returned.

title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
text: downloading data purposes editing exploring history objects, perhaps better use Overpass API. similar function download OSM objects using Overpass, implemented osmdata::opq().

title: Retrieve map data by bounding box — osm_bbox_objects
code: map_data <- osm_bbox_objects(bbox = c(1.8366775, 41.8336843, 1.8379971, 41.8344537)) ## bbox as a character value also works. Equivalent call: # map_data <- osm_bbox_objects(bbox = "1.8366775,41.8336843,1.8379971,41.8344537") map_data #>  [1] type      id        visible   version   changeset timestamp user      #>  [8] uid       lat       lon       members   tags      #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

title: Search for notes — osm_search_notes
code: osm_search_notes(   q,   user,   bbox,   from,   to,   closed = 7,   sort = c("updated_at", "created_at"),   order = c("newest", "oldest"),   limit = 100,   format = c("R", "xml", "rss", "json", "gpx") )

title: Search for notes — osm_search_notes
text: q Text search query, matching either note text comments. user Search notes given user interacted . value can user id (numeric) display name (character). bbox Search area expressed string coordinates valid bounding box (left,bottom,right,top) decimal degrees. Area must 25 square degrees (see osm_capabilities()$note_area line settings current value). Beginning date range created_at updated_at (specified sort). Preferably ISO 8601 date format. End date range created_at updated_at (specified sort). Preferably ISO 8601 date format. works supplied. closed Specifies number days note needs closed longer returned. value 0 means open notes returned. value -1 means notes returned. 7 default. sort Sort results creation (created_at) update date (updated_at, default). order Sorting order. oldest ascending order, newest descending order (default). limit Maximum number results 1 10000 (may change, see osm_capabilities()$api$notes current value). Default 100. format Format returned list notes. Can R (default), xml, rss, json gpx.
